title: Girl with Lobster
snippet: This paingint resides in the Official Bad Art Museum of Art, Seattle, Washington. USA, also known by the acronym
), and is located inside Cafe Racer.

title: Mana Lisa
snippet: Donated by the artist to the Museum of Bad Art in Somerville, Massechusettes, USA.

title: Charlie
snippet: Donated by the artist to the Museum of Bad Art in Somerville, Massechusettes, USA.

title: Sheeba
snippet: Sheeba, freind of Charlie.  Purchased at a Boston thrift store.

title: Mama and Babe
snippet: Donated by the artist to the Museum of Bad Art in Somerville, Massechusettes, USA.

title: Gilded Nude
snippet: The viewer is struck immediately by the youthful female subject’s oversized ... arm.  Gallery owner Michael Frank says this piece exemplifies the mission of the Museum of Bad Art (MOBA) in Boston, USA.

title: A Tree Grows in Boston
snippet: Purchased by Mike Frank at a Boston thrift shop, April 2011.

title: Sam and James Bourne
snippet: This painting is on David Bradbury's Bad Art website.  It was a wedding present commission from Kirstin Hodgkinson. Sam has a sandwich in her mouth. It doesn't look like a sandwich because the artist said he ran out of white paint and the deadline was close.

title: Gingerminge
snippet: Shown at Tate Liverpool, Jake and Dinos Chapman address controversial issues in their pieces, often pitched at the boundaries of taste.

title: Glitterati Elvis
snippet: In the permanent collection of the Official Bad Art Museum of Art in Seattle, WA, USA.

title: Think Again
snippet: Acquired by Scott Wilson from trash.

title: Self Portrait
snippet: The title piece for the Bad Art by David Bradbury website acoompanied by the quote: All art is quite useless - Oscar Wilde.

title: Woman III
snippet: As of 2015, this is the third most expensive painting ever sold.  In 2006 it sold at auction to Steven A. Cohen for $137.5 million.

title: Dora Maar au Chat (Dora Maar with Cat)
snippet: The painter's lover, seated on a chair with a small cat perched on her shoulders.  One of the world's most expensive paintings, it was sold at auction in 2006 in New York to an anonymous Russian bidder for US$95,216,000.

title: Portrait of Docteur Gachet
snippet: The most revered painting showing the doctor who took care of Van Gogh during the final months of his life.  It was sold for $ 82.5 million in 1990.

title: False Start
snippet: Sold for $94.4 in 2006 in a private sale to Kenneth C. Griffin. Critical commentary has been devoted to the contradictions of the mislabeling of colour names, saying it is uninteresting but then discussed it at length.

title: Mona Lisa
snippet: Thought to be a portrait of Lisa Gherardini, this painting has the highest insurance value of around US$780 million today.

title: No. 5, 1948
snippet: In 2006 this painting was sold to David Martinez in a private sale for $140 million.

title: Portrait of Adele Bloch-Bauer I
medium: Oil, silver, and gold on canvas
snippet: The first of two portraits Klimt painted of Bloch-Bauer, a refined art-loving Viennese salon lady.  The painting was appropriated by the Nazis, and later sold for US$135 million to Ronald Lauder for his Neue Galerie in New York City in June 2006.
